page.title: 07A LAMPLUGH HOUSE
page.content: 2, The Green, Lamplugh, Workington, Cumbria. The house is not a council house there are 7 rooms. It is heated with a coal fire and back fire boiler. The lighting is by electricity. There are four people living in the house two work at Sellafield, one at a Kangol factory in Frizington and one is a part-time dinner-lady she also does the house jobs. The house is 35 years old in 1985. Coal, papers and milk are deliverd to the house. The papers they get are: Daily Mirror, Whitehaven news. The grocery shopping is done in Frizington and the clothes shopping is done in Workington. They have 1 telephone and three televisions. The biggest job in the house is preparing meals. They have a stray cat which is pure white.
